pages.content:
[HEADING] Master Agricultural Sciences
[HEADING] Specialisations
[HEADING] Language of instruction
[HEADING] Credits | duration
[HEADING] Academic title
[HEADING] Requirement profile
[HEADING] Detailed information
[HEADING] Contact
Agricultural scientists take a system-oriented approach. This means that they think and act along interdisciplinary lines and view entire systems from a scientific, sociological and technical perspective. Agricultural sciences are based on mathematics, natural and social sciences, which is why we require you to have an appropriate profile when applying.
Graduates of the Master's level have theoretical and methodological skills as well as social competences for entering a professional or academic career. Possible places of employment are research institutes, consulting firms, international organisations, food companies and other service providers.
Agricultural scientists develop concepts for ecological, economic and socially acceptable food production, whether in Switzerland or in various regions of the world.
120 ECTS | 2 years
Master of Science ETH in Agricultural Sciences
Download MSc Agricultural Sciences (PDF, 277 KB)

links.anchor_text: Master’s degree programme in Agricultural Sciences

pages.title: Master Agricultural Sciences | ETH Zurich

pages.content:
[HEADING] Contact
In the Master's programme, students develop expertise in Agricultural Sciences and apply it in a professional environment during an internship. The Master's thesis represents the completion of the Master's programme.
Students gain knowledge about relevant research questions and findings from both fundamental and applied research. They operate successfully in the balance between globalisation and regional identity, competitiveness and sustainability, and the interests of business and society.
Graduates from the Master’s degree programme are equipped with high-level theoretical and methodological competence and with social skills to take up challenging professional work or an academic career.
Students select one major, which then defines the main focus of their studies. They can further shape their personal study profile by selecting their desired combination of major, minor and elective subjects.
A student’s professional identity is defined by the chosen major. Students can choose from three majors:
Additionally, students can choose a combination of either electives of 10 credit points (CP) and a minor of 10 credit points each or two minors of 10 CP each (overall 20 CP).  An internship is another obligatory part of the Master's programme. It is usually completed in the third Master's semester and lasts at least 16 weeks. The Master's thesis forms the conclusion of the Master's programme.
The Master’s degree programme in Agricultural Sciences requires 120 credit points (as shown below).
Download Master’s Programme in Agricultural Sciences: List of Courses 2025/2026 (PDF, 71 KB)
The Master’s degree in Agricultural Sciences gives graduates the title “Master of Science ETH in Agricultural Sciences”, and qualifies them to enter professional life or study for a doctorate.
Download Study Guide Master’s Programme 2025/2026 (PDF, 1.8 MB)

pages.title: – Department of Environmental Systems Science | ETH Zurich

pages.content:
[HEADING] Master’s degree studies
[HEADING] Personal initiative and cross-disciplinary competences
[HEADING] Contact
[HEADING] FAQ Master
[HEADING] Application
[HEADING] Master’s studies
[HEADING] Telephone hours
[HEADING] Desk opening hours
Is it your goal to do cutting-edge research, start your own company or pursue a career in business, industry or administration? A Master’s degree from ETH Zurich would be the ideal stepping stone to your future.
ETH Zurich is one of the world’s leading technical and scientific universities. With members from over 100 nations, we offer our students an inspiring, diverse environment.
During your studies you will have the chance to interact with top researchers, address the latest scientific knowledge in your field and apply it in practice.
Take advantage of the range of selections offered in our curricula and shape your studies according to your personal strengths and interests. We count on your personal initiative, and will help you to develop your own projects. Besides imparting knowledge and skills for your future career we will prepare you for the responsibilities you will assume in society as a graduate. For this reason, we lay great weight on the development of cross-disciplinary competences such as critical reflection and argumentation.
The prerequisites for undertaking graduate studies at ETH Zurich are a Bachelor’s degree from an internationally recognised university and excellent grades. Our students immerse themselves independently and enthusiastically in their chosen fields, pursue discussion with peers and faculty, and value cultural and academic diversity.
Please understand that we cannot provide academic guidance in advance or assess your chances of admission.
Frequently asked questions on Master's degree studies and application
If you have questions about applying for Master’s degree studies (formal admission prerequisites, application process), which are not  answered in the FAQ section, please contact the Admissions Office.
If you have questions on the content of a degree programme, please contact the person responsible for the respective programme directly .

pages.title: Master’s degree studies | ETH Zurich

pages.content:
[HEADING] Range of degree programmes
[HEADING] Structure of Master’s degree studies
[HEADING] Consecutive Master’s degree programmes
[HEADING] Specialised Master’s degree programmes
During Master’s degree studies you will deepen your knowledge of your chosen academic discipline and specialise in one or more of its aspects. ETH Zurich offers both consecutive and specialised Master’s degree programmes.
In their content, consecutive Master’s degree programmes represent a continu­ation of the respective Bachelor’s degree pro­gramme. For every Bachelor’s pro­gramme we offer at least one consecutive Master’s programme.
Specialised Master’s degree programmes address one particular topic, which is taught from an interdisciplinary and international perspective.
